chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01/22/16, received and filed. (34 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
Sworn as interpreters:  Brenda Bartholomew for defendant and Dawn Maldonado for victim.

Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.    

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 51 months consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 242 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Referral to Mental health Unit
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Take medicine as prescribed.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*No illegal drugs or controlled substances.
*No contact with Juan DS or the address of 1564 S 6th St, Milwaukee.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $490.00 to be paid to Juan DS.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison income, wages or assets, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.


Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
filed.  Count 1:  Robbery (Threat of Force), contrary to sec. 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e) Wis. Stats.  a Class E Felony.
filed.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in court with Attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment of today's scheduled plea and sentencing hearing.
Discussion with the parties regarding the number of adjournments.  Court will grant adjournment and orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Parties request an adjournment of the currently scheduled plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in custody.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Megan Carmody, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JUAN D-S. AND ANGELICA F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Brando Alberto Ruiz-Ramos in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
